text:
John Douglas Rowland (7 April 1941 – 2020) was an English footballer.
He began his career at Nottingham Forest in 1960, before being sold on to Port Vale in August 1962.
In September 1966, he was sold on to Mansfield Town. Two years later he joined Tranmere Rovers, before dropping into non-league football with South Shields in 1969. He finished his career at Derry City.
His death was announced on 20 November 2020 at the age of 79.
